title: 15 DIY SIMPLE LIFE HACKS WITH RUBBER BANDS

json.text: Hi!
Oh sweaty
It's a sleeve, it's a fan, it's a sleeve, it's a fan!
Hey guys it's Wengie!
Welcome back!
What happened to my voice!
And, right now, fan hug!
So today I wanted to show you some really super cool rubber band hacks
They are so amazing guys
I could not believe what you could do with a simple rubber band
You guys are gonna love it!
And if you guys didn't know, I actually have a music channel
All the music during this video, if you guys like it, you can listen to it more
So you guys should check the link out down below
But hold up if you guys aren't part of the fam yet here already I encourage you guys to join
just click the subscribe button
You'd be automatically entered into the current MacBook Air giveaway
Which is drawn
Super soon!
The only other you guys need to do to be part of this giveaway is be part of my #vlogsquad
Which means subscribe to my vlog channel which is linked down below
And that is literally it, these two things
And we have another like challenge this week which I really need your guys help in
and that is to get this video to 150,000 thumbs up
We are doing these like challenges like super quickly so
I'm so proud of you guys!
I can't even express it
So without further ado, let's get on with the video
Let's go!
If you're terrible with chopsticks or don't know how to hold them properly
You can use this awesome hack to create you're own training chopsticks
Just take a small bit of paper or tissue and roll it up into a small tube
Then place it between you're chopsticks near the top
Then wrap a rubber band around both chopsticks above the piece of paper and you're done!
This actually works pretty well
And as you can see I can pick up my unicorns pretty easily
So definitely try this out if you've ever had a burning desire to use chopsticks
And don't know where to start
Have you ever bought the perfect pair of glasses
Only to find that they slip down you're nose whilst wearing them?
And then you have to keep pushing them back up you're face and it becomes more and more annoying
Well you can easily fix this by adding some rubber bands onto the ends of the glasses
Just wrap each band around a few times to create a small bump which will then sit just behind you're ear
and keep it in place
Honestly I can't believe I never knew about this hack it's so simple and practical
And I'll definitely be showcasing some of my old sunnies that never used to fit right
And it'll definitely be useful when I'm wearing glasses and I'm trying to read a book
And they keep sliding down my face
If you're doing some simple painting at home
You can use a rubber band to help keep things tidy
Just wrap it around your paint tin vertically and use it to wipe off excess paint
So it doesn't drip anywhere
It's actually pretty satisfying to watch
Check it out
Whenever I watch a sad movie, I like to feel what the character's feel
And sometimes I get a bit carried away
And yeah, sure, things can get a bit messy
So here's a hack to help with that
Next time you finish a box of tissues, don't throw it away
Place it next to the new box of tissues and tie them together with some rubber bands
This creates a convenient tissue bin so you aren't left with used tissues everywhere
because you are too lazy to throw them in the actual bin
So you're happily drinking and something distracts you
Yeah, I get distracted pretty easily
So here's what you can do
Wrap a rubber band around the neck of a water bottle
And then use the extra bit to wrap around your straw
Ta-da!
You'll never have to go straw-fishing again
If you're a bookworm, you'll appreciate easy page turning with this hack
And no, it's not licking you're fingers
Not that there's anything wrong with that
Just wrap a rubber band around your finger instead and you'll be able to easily turn each page
without licking all the bacteria from your finger
It's super important to stay hydrated during the day
and I like to keep track of how many cups of water I'm drinking to make sure I have enough
But instead of writing on your water bottle and ruining it
you can try using rubber bands instead to mark out each cup
And if you have thick rubber bands as well you can write straight onto the rubber band
It looks super cute and won't ruin your bottle
And you'll easily be able to see how many cups of water you had
We all have those clothes that just fall off you're hanger no matter what
So try this hack next time
Just wrap a rubber band around the two ends of the clothes hanger
This should create a bit of extra grip so you're clothes won't slip off the ends
It's also so simple I'm not sure why I never thought of it before
But I'll definitely be using this on all my hangers in the future
There are so many life hacks for opening tight jars lids
I think the best one is probably to get stronger
But if you're a bit of a weakling like me, you can try this next hack
Just take a rubber band and wrap it around the edge of the lid
This might provide just enough extra grip for you're slippery fingers to open that lid
Who else gets so satisfied when they hear that seal break?
Or is it just me?
You can also do this with nail polish lids as well
Or basically anything with a slippery lid
Just wrap your rubber band a few times around your nail polish lid
And you'll easily be able to twist it off
So you're cutting something big and heavy on a chopping board
And it just keeps slipping and sliding everywhere
Not only is this super annoying but it can actually be quite dangerous
So next time try putting a rubber band around each end of the chopping board
It'll give extra grip so it doesn't slip all over your kitchen bench
And, might just save a finger
You can thank me later
Whenever I'm at a party, I always put my drink down somewhere
And then when I come back to it
It's magically surrounded by other cups and I can't figure out which one is mine
Instead, just put a coloured rubber band around your cup
That'll make it easier for your guests to remember which cups are theirs
It's the little things that are the most memorable
Does this ever happen to your books when you put it in your bag?
Yeah, me too
And I always feel so bad like I haven't cared them properly
So, to avoid this from ever happening
Just place a rubber band around your book before putting it in your bag
That way it won't randomly open up inside
You can also use this with magazines to keep them neat as well
Does this happen to your spoon?
Yeah
It happens to me all the time
Like, soups or noodles and I cringe every time I have to fish it out with my fingers
I don't know why but for some reason it just feels so wrong
Anyway, you can prevent this from happening ever again with a rubber band
Just wrap it around the spoon handle several times to create a small bump
This will basically catch the spoon on the edge of the bowl if it starts to slip
Which is a life saver for me
If you've run out of tissues, you can create emergency tissues with a toilet roll
Or you can just save some money with this
Just take a toilet roll and wrap a rubber band around it
Then take the middle cardboard cylinder out by cutting it and then slipping it out
And pull some of the toilet paper out from the inside
Now place it in an empty tissue box so you can't see the toilet roll
And it almost looks like real tissues
So if you ever need to roll dough
Like, say, when you're making some home cooked pizza or dumplings
You might find it hard to roll it to the same thickness all over
So instead take some rubber bands and wrap them round each end of the rolling pin
at the height that you want
This creates a gap beneath the pin so you don't need to worry about accidently rolling a section too thin
So you'll actually have evenly rolled pizza slices every single time
So if you guys learned something new today, I hope you guys did
